atDirectives.name: @import
atDirectives.description: Use the `@import` directive to inline import CSS files, including Tailwind itself.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the `@theme` directive to define your project's custom design tokens, like fonts, colors, and breakpoints.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Use the `@source` directive to specify which files to scan for class names.

atDirectives.name: @utility
atDirectives.description: Use the `@utility` directive to define custom utility classes.

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@variant` directive to define custom variants.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@custom-variant` directive to define custom variants with more complex behavior.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @reference
atDirectives.description: Use the `@reference` directive to import your main stylesheet for reference without actually including the styles.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to control the order of how CSS is applied. Valid layers are `theme`, `base`, `components`, and `utilities`.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the `@config` directive to load a legacy JavaScript-based configuration file. This exists solely for compatibility with Tailwind CSS v3.x.

atDirectives.name: @plugin
atDirectives.description: Use the `@plugin` directive to load a legacy JavaScript-based plugin. This exists solely for compatibility with Tailwind CSS v3.x.
